evidence.text: Within six months of the Effective Date, the Jail will consult with the Monitor to draft and/or revise policies and procedures to incorporate and align them with the provisions in this Agreement.

extracted.value: Draft and revise policies and procedures within six months of Effective Date

evidence.text: Within one year of the Effective Date, all policies and procedures that needed to be drafted and/or revised to incorporate and align them with the provisions in this Agreement will be adopted by the Jail.

extracted.value: Adopt policies and procedures within one year of Effective Date

evidence.text: Prior to adoption, the Jail will provide a copy of the policy or procedure to the United States for review, comment, and approval. The United States will not unreasonably refuse to approve submitted policies or procedures.

extracted.value: Submit policies to United States for review and approval prior to adoption

evidence.text: No later than three months after the United States' approval of each policy and procedure (except as otherwise stated in the Agreement), the Jail will adopt and begin implementing the policy and procedure.

extracted.value: Implement policies within three months after United States approval

evidence.text: The Jail will annually review its policies and procedures, revising them as necessary. Any revisions to the policies and procedures will be submitted to the United States for approval in accordance with Paragraph 20.a above.

extracted.value: Conduct annual policy reviews with United States approval

evidence.text: Within four months of the Effective Date, and annually thereafter, the Jail will submit to the Monitor and the United States a staffing plan for security, medical, and mental health staff adequate to achieve compliance with this Agreement on the timelines set out in this Agreement.

extracted.value: Submit staffing plans within four months of Effective Date

evidence.text: The Jail will staff the facility based on each staffing plan within one fiscal year of the completion of each staffing plan.

extracted.value: Implement staffing plans within one fiscal year of completion

evidence.text: The Jail will provide pre-service and annual in-service training, using competency-based adult learning techniques, to security, medical, and mental health staff on new policies, mental health care and suicide prevention, and de-escalation techniques.

extracted.value: Provide pre-service and annual in-service training on mental health, suicide prevention, and de-escalation

evidence.text: Within six months of the Effective Date, the Jail will incorporate any relevant Agreement requirements and any recommendations from the Monitor into its annual training plan that indicates the type and length of training and a schedule indicating which staff will be trained at which times.

extracted.value: Incorporate Agreement requirements into annual training plan within six months

evidence.text: The annual in-service training will ensure that all current security, medical, and mental health staff are trained within six months after new policies have been approved by the United States, with all training completed no later than 18 months after the Effective Date.

extracted.value: Train all security, medical, and mental health staff within 18 months of Effective Date
